content: For https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/75239, a new lint feels appropriate. I thought we could just make a PR and maybe ask for t-compiler FCP in there, but now I heard from @oli they think RFC or at least MCP is necessary for a lint. What is the process here?
To me, a new lint doesn't feel "major" at all, so I was quite surprised that paperwork (beyond FCP) would be required^^

I want that lint too. But I agree that new lint should be accepted by compiler team.
Since the lint has to maintain forward compatible with new Rust releases.
My understanding historically has been that compiler team approval is not necessary and Lang team approval is.
I guess we can discuss this Thursday

oh, wrong team then. fair.
my question was more about FCP vs something more heavy.

simulacrum said:

I guess we can discuss this Thursday

okay, I'll nominate for lang team discussion
heh I meant compiler team discussion to confirm compiler team does not want to approve, but sure
I think FCP is more than sufficient personally, I'd be fine with MCP-style "no objections" too
@RalfJ I personally think that an FCP is completely sufficient here.
let me add this to the list of "policy things to clarify"
I agree that nominating the PR and asking for FCP on the PR suffices
